column2: CHAPTER XXIII
column3: CHAPTER twenty three

column2: Each of these facts seemed struggling for complete possession of his thoughts.
column3: Each of these facts seemed struggling for complete possession of his thoughts.

column2: The men in yellow, and men whom he fancied were called Ward Leaders, were either propelling him forward or following him obediently; it was hard to tell.
column3: The men in yellow, and men whom he fancied were called Ward Leaders, were either propelling him forward or following him obediently; it was hard to tell.

column2: Perhaps some power unseen and unsuspected propelled them all.
column3: Perhaps some power unseen and unsuspected propelled them all.

column2: Many little things happened, and then he found himself with the man in yellow entering a little room where this proclamation of his was to be made.
column3: Many little things happened, and then he found himself with the man in yellow entering a little room where this proclamation of his was to be made.

column2: In the centre was a bright oval lit by shaded electric lights from above.
column3: In the centre was a bright oval lit by shaded electric lights from above.

column2: The huge ears of a phonographic mechanism gaped in a battery for his words, the black eyes of great photographic cameras awaited his beginning, beyond metal rods and coils glittered dimly, and something whirled about with a droning hum.
column3: The huge ears of a phonographic mechanism gaped in a battery for his words, the black eyes of great photographic cameras awaited his beginning, beyond metal rods and coils glittered dimly, and something whirled about with a droning hum.

column2: He walked into the centre of the light, and his shadow drew together black and sharp to a little blot at his feet.
column3: He walked into the centre of the light, and his shadow drew together black and sharp to a little blot at his feet.

column2: For a moment, he said, "I must wait.
column3: For a moment, he said, "I must wait.

column2: While he was still hesitating there came an agitated messenger with news that the foremost aeroplanes were passing over Madrid.
column3: While he was still hesitating there came an agitated messenger with news that the foremost aeroplanes were passing over Madrid.

column2: Ready!
column3: Ready!

column2: Aeroplanes at Madrid!
column3: Aeroplanes at Madrid!

column2: Oh! what can it matter whether I speak well or ill? he said, and felt the light grow brighter.
column3: Oh! what can it matter whether I speak well or ill? he said, and felt the light grow brighter.

column2: Abruptly it was perfectly clear to him that this revolt against Ostrog was premature, foredoomed to failure, the impulse of passionate inadequacy against inevitable things.
column3: Abruptly it was perfectly clear to him that this revolt against Ostrog was premature, foredoomed to failure, the impulse of passionate inadequacy against inevitable things.

column2: Even as he stood, awkward, hesitating, with an indiscreet apology for his inability trembling on his lips, came the noise of many people crying out, the running to and fro of feet.
column3: Even as he stood, awkward, hesitating, with an indiscreet apology for his inability trembling on his lips, came the noise of many people crying out, the running to and fro of feet.

column2: Wait, cried someone, and a door opened.
column3: Wait, cried someone, and a door opened.

column2: Graham turned, and the watching lights waned.
column3: Graham turned, and the watching lights waned.

column2: Through the open doorway he saw a slight girlish figure approaching.
column3: Through the open doorway he saw a slight girlish figure approaching.

column2: His heart leapt.
column3: His heart leapt.

column2: It was Helen Wotton.
column3: It was Helen Wotton.

column2: This is the girl who told us what Ostrog had done, he said.
column3: This is the girl who told us what Ostrog had done, he said.

column2: She came in very quietly, and stood still, as if she did not want to interrupt Graham's eloquence....
column3: She came in very quietly, and stood still, as if she did not want to interrupt Graham's eloquence....

column2: But his doubts and questionings fled before her presence.
column3: But his doubts and questionings fled before her presence.

column2: He turned back to her.
column3: He turned back to her.

column2: You have helped me, he said lamely--"helped me very much....
column3: You have helped me, he said lamely-"helped me very much....

column2: He addressed himself to the unseen multitudes who stared upon him through those grotesque black eyes.
column3: He addressed himself to the unseen multitudes who stared upon him through those grotesque black eyes.

column2: At first he spoke slowly.
column3: At first he spoke slowly.

column2: He stopped to gather words.
column3: He stopped to gather words.

column2: All your lives, it may be, you must fight.
column3: All your lives, it may be, you must fight.

column2: Take no thought though I am beaten, though I am utterly overthrown.
column3: Take no thought though I am beaten, though I am utterly overthrown.

column2: He paused momentarily, and broke into vague exhortations, and then a rush of speech came upon him.
column3: He paused momentarily, and broke into vague exhortations, and then a rush of speech came upon him.

column2: So we hoped in the days that are past.
column3: So we hoped in the days that are past.

column2: How is it with man after two hundred years?
column3: How is it with man after two hundred years?

column2: Great cities, vast powers, a collective greatness beyond our dreams.	Great cities, vast powers, a collective greatness beyond our dreams.
For that we did not work, and that has come.
column3: For that we did not work, and that has come.

column2: How is it with the common lives?
column3: How is it with the common lives?

column2: As it has ever been--sorrow and labour, lives cramped and unfulfilled, lives tempted by power, tempted by wealth, and gone to waste and folly.
column3: As it has ever been-sorrow and labour, lives cramped and unfulfilled, lives tempted by power, tempted by wealth, and gone to waste and folly.

column2: It does not matter if you understand. It does not matter if you seem to fail.
column3: It does not matter if you understand. It does not matter if you seem to fail.

column2: There is no promise, there is no security--nothing to go upon but Faith.
column3: There is no promise, there is no security-nothing to go upon but Faith.

column2: There is no faith but faith--faith which is courage...."
column3: There is no faith but faith-faith which is courage...."

column2: He spoke gustily, in broken incomplete sentences, but with all his heart and strength, of this new faith within him.
column3: He spoke gustily, in broken incomplete sentences, but with all his heart and strength, of this new faith within him.

column2: His eloquence limped no longer.
column3: His eloquence limped no longer.

column2: And at last he made an end to speaking.
column3: And at last he made an end to speaking.

column2: To all of you.
column3: To all of you.

column2: I give it to you, and myself I give to you.
column3: I give it to you, and myself I give to you.

column2: He found the light of his present exaltation reflected in the face of the girl.
column3: He found the light of his present exaltation reflected in the face of the girl.

column2: I knew you would say these things...."
column3: I knew you would say these things...."
